lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau ngr eyk hoq hY Anyk hwtY gwhk AsMK AwvY bycn Aru lYn kau
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Nagar Ayk Hot Hai Anayk Haatai , Gaahak Asankh Aavai Baychan Aru Lain Kau ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a town has many shops which are visited by many customers who go there to buy or sell their merchandise.

lines.gurmukhi: jwpY kCu bycY Aru bnju n mwgY pwvY Awn pY ibswhY jwie dyKY suK nYn kau
lines.transliteration_english: Jaapai Kachhu Baychai Aru Banaju N Maagai Paavai , Aan Pai Bisaahai Jaai Daykhai Soukh Nain Kau ?

Shabad OS B.translation: When a customer who has sold something at a shop is unable to buy something from there since it is not available, he visits other shops. Finding his requirements there, he feels happy and relaxed.

lines.gurmukhi: jw kI hwt skl smgRI pwvY Aau ibkwvY bycq ibswhq cwhq icq cYn kau
lines.transliteration_english: Jaa Kee Haat Sakal Samagree Paavai Au Bikaavai , Baychat Bisaahat Chaahat Chit Chain Kau ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A shopkeeper who keeps all types of commodities in his shop and which are sold frequently, a customer generally likes to sell or purchase from there. He feels happy and satisfied.

lines.gurmukhi: Awn dyv syv jwih siqgur pUry swh srb inDwn jw kY lYn Aru dYn kau ]454]
lines.transliteration_english: Aan Dayv Sayv Jaahi Satigur Pooray Saaha , Sarab Nidhaan Jaa Kai Lain Aru Dain Kau ?454?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, if a follower of other god comes to the refuge of the perfect True Guru, he will find that his store-house is filled with all types of trading commodities (of loving worship).  (454)
